summary: This document is an email chain from August 24, 2019, between attorney Sigrid McCawley and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding logistics for an upcoming court hearing. It discusses a draft letter, a change in hearing location, and coordination for victims planning to attend.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.role: Attorney/Partner at Boies Schiller Flexner LLP
persons.context: Attorney representing victims, coordinating logistics for an upcoming court hearing, and circulating a draft letter discussed with David Boies.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Mentioned as having discussed a draft letter with Sigrid McCawley regarding the hearing.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, recipient or sender in the email chain regarding hearing logistics.

persons.name: J. Berman
persons.context: Recipient of a draft letter attached to the email, referenced in the attachment filename.

connections.description: Collaborating on legal strategy and draft correspondence related to the hearing.
Communicating regarding logistical coordination for an upcoming court hearing.
McCawley's firm is preparing a draft letter addressed to J. Berman.

events.title: Upcoming Court Hearing/Conference
events.description: A court hearing or conference is scheduled, with logistics being coordinated between victim attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's office. The location was moved to the 40 Foley courthouse, courtroom 110.

events.title: Logistics Call Coordination
events.description: Attorneys schedule and discuss calls over the weekend to prepare for the upcoming Tuesday hearing, including reviewing a draft letter.

keyFacts: Victims' attorney Sigrid McCawley is coordinating for victims to attend a court hearing on or around August 27, 2019.
The hearing location was changed to the 40 Foley courthouse, courtroom 110.
A draft letter from the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner to U.S. Attorney J. Berman was circulated for review on August 24, 2019.
Communication shows active coordination between victim counsel and the U.S. Attorney's office (AUSA Maurene) regarding hearing logistics.
